channel.title: D-Link 615 Router
channel.description:
Ok this shit pissing me off now... I have a D-Link 615 router and when i play COD on the PC it cannot connect to many servers, 1 in 10 maybe?
People say i need to open the NAT, there is no option on the router so i enabled DMZ on my pc, still no luck...
Is it an error on my end or IW's end?
p.s. IWNet is shit

@Ollie wrote:

Seems like i’m not the only one

item.title: D-Link 615 Router
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

Try enabling UPnP ? I found this looking through the console on game load:

UPNP: Testing device 'urn:schemas-upnp-org:device:InternetGatewayDevice:1' by sending packet to 239.255.255.250:1900 UPNP: Testing device 'urn:schemas-upnp-org:service:WANIPConnection:1' by sending packet to 239.255.255.250:1900 UPNP: Testing device 'urn:schemas-upnp-org:service:WANPPPConnection:1' by sending packet to 239.255.255.250:1900 UPNP: Testing device 'upnp:rootdevice' by sending packet to 239.255.255.250:1900 gatewayValue: 192.168.2.1

Read full topic

item.title: D-Link 615 Router
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

yes MW2, will check log when i am back home!

I am pretty sure i have firewall disabled though as it is in the same menu as the DMZ option

Read full topic

item.title: D-Link 615 Router
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

MW2?

If so, MW2 has no servers, it is purely P2P (as in, UDP).

Check the router’s security log, if you have the firewall enabled it is most likely blocking MW2 traffic because it thinks it’s a UDP flood. Happened to me with CSS and a Belkin router, but it could definitely apply here.

Read full topic
